Shlok: न च श्रोत्रजिह्वे न च घ्राण न च विषया
Transliteration: na cha shrotrajihve na cha ghraana na cha vishayaa
Translation: Neither the senses nor the organs of action, nor the objects of the senses...
You have a right to perform your prescribed duty, but you are not entitled to the fruits of action.
One who is not disturbed in mind, nor does he hanker after happiness...
The Lord of creatures, having created all beings along with their different duties...

Shlok: यदा यदा हि धर्मस्य ग्लानिर्भवति भारत
Transliteration: yada yada hi dharmasya glanirbhavati bharata
Translation: Whenever and wherever there is a decline in religious practice, O Bharata...

Shlok: कर्मण्यकर्म यः पश्येदकर्मणि च कर्म यः
Transliteration: karmanyakarm yah pashyedakarmani cha karm yah
Translation: One who sees inaction in action, and action in inaction, is intelligent among men...
Others, who are interested in the cultivation of knowledge, offer the functions of the senses...

Shlok: अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः
Transliteration: anashritah karmaphalam karyam karm karoti yah
Translation: One who is not attached to the fruits of his work and who works as he is obligated...
The self-controlled soul, who engages in the practice of yoga, attains peace...

Shlok: मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते
Transliteration: mameva ye prapadyante mayametam taranti te
Translation: Those who take shelter in Me, they cross over this maya...
And whoever, at the time of death, quits his body, remembering Me alone...

Shlok: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति
Transliteration: patram pushpam phalam toyam yo me bhaktya prayachchhati
Translation: If one offers Me with love a leaf, a flower, a fruit or water...

Shlok: मान्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु
Transliteration: manmana bhava madbhakto madyaji mam namaskuru
Translation: Engage your mind always in thinking of Me, offer obeisances and worship Me...
To show them special mercy, I, dwelling in their hearts, destroy with the shining lamp of knowledge...
If hundreds of thousands of suns were to rise simultaneously in the sky...

Shlok: यदि भाः सदृशी सा स्याद्भासस्तस्य महात्मनः
Transliteration: yadi bhaah sadrishi sa syaad bhaasastasya mahaatmanah
Translation: If hundreds of thousands of suns were to rise simultaneously in the sky...
Those who, renouncing all actions in Me, and dedicated to the path of yoga...
Better indeed is knowledge than practice, than knowledge is meditation...
Having attained Me, the great souls do not take birth again in this miserable transitory world...
One who has transcended these three gunas, which are born of the body...
The mode of goodness, being purifying, is illuminating, and it is the cause of liberation...

Shlok: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवर्तते ज्ञानं यदा च रजस्तमः
Transliteration: yada satve pravartate jnaanam yada cha rajastamah
Translation: When the mode of goodness is predominant, the knowledge of the self is manifest...
The Blessed Lord said: There is a banyan tree which has its roots upward and its branches downward...
The living entities in this conditioned world are My eternal fragmental parts...
Fearlessness, purification of one's existence, cultivation of spiritual knowledge...
But those who, neglecting the regulations of the scriptures, worship according to their whims...

Shlok: अर्जुन उवाच ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजंते श्रद्धयान्विताः
Transliteration: arjuna uvacha ye shastravidhimutsrijya yajante shraddhayaanvitah
Translation: Arjuna said: Those who, neglecting the regulations of the scriptures, worship according to their whims...
Worship of the Lord, worship of the brahmanas, worship of the spiritual master...
One who has taken complete shelter of Me, being situated in the spiritual platform...
Abandon all varieties of religion and just surrender unto Me...

Shlok: यत्र योगेश्वरः कृष्णो यत्र पार्थो धनुर्धरः
Transliteration: yatra yogeshwarah krishno yatra paartho dhanurdharah
Translation: Wherever there is Krishna, the Lord of yoga, and wherever there is Arjuna...
Dhritarashtra said: In the place of pilgrimage, Kurukshetra...
Sanjaya said: Having spoken thus, the mighty-armed one, Hrishikesha...

Shlok: न त्वेवाहं जातु नासं न त्वं नेमे जनाधिपाः
Transliteration: na tvevaaham jaatu naasam na tvaam neme janadhipaah
Translation: Never was there a time when I did not exist, nor you, nor all these kings...

Shlok: वासांसि जीर्णानि यथा विहाय नवानि गृह्णाति नरोऽपराणि
Transliteration: vaasaamsi jiirnaani yathaa vihaaya navaani grihnaati naro.aparaani
Translation: As a person puts on new garments, giving up old ones, the soul similarly accepts new material bodies...
In this endeavor, there is no loss or diminution, and a little advancement on this path can protect one from the most dangerous type of fear...
Whatever action is performed by a great man, common men follow in his footsteps...
It is better to discharge one's prescribed duties, even though faultily, than to perform another's duties perfectly...
Even if you are the most sinful of all sinners, you shall cross over all sins by the raft of knowledge...
Others, who are interested in the cultivation of knowledge, offer the functions of the senses...
One must deliver himself with the help of his mind, and not degrade himself...
The self-controlled soul, who engages in the practice of yoga, attains peace...
